event.alert_text: HAVE YOU BEEN GOOD THIS YEAR? HAVE YOU BEEN VERY, VERY GOOD?
IT'S HEMPY'S BIRTHDAY! ANOTHER YEAR OLDER, ANOTHER YEAR WISER, EH BUDDY?
ENJOY THIS TREAT - NO TRICKS INCLUDED!
ANOTHER YEAR CLOSER TO THE GRAVE, EH BUDDY?
TUNE IN TO THE EUROVISION SONG CONTEST AND CELEBRATE UNITY!
YOU FOUND A SHOEBOX FULL OF CASH! IT'S ONLY A LITTLE SOGGY...
YOU FOUND A DINOSAUR TAILBONE... BUT ITS NOT IN VERY GOOD CONDITION.
YOU FOUND A DINOSAUR TAILBONE... AND IT'S IN GREAT CONDITION!
SOMETHING BIT YOU! IT BURNS! WHAT WAS THAT?!
YOU FOUND A TIME CAPSULE, AND IT'S FULL OF OLD BASEBALL CARDS! DON'T CHEW THE GUM...
A GNOME WAS MEDITATING IN THE DIRT! HE WINKED AT YOU! YOU FEEL A LITTLE WISER...
A GNOME WAS SLEEPING IN THE DIRT! HE'S CRANKY! HE GAVE YOU THE EVIL EYE...
YOU FOUND A DOLLAR BILL NESTLED BETWEEN TWO PIECES OF DIRT!
YOU FOUND A SMALL METEORITE! THERE'S A VEIN OF GLOWING METAL RUNNING THROUGH IT...
AS YOU STAND UP, A SMALL MOUSE WITH A CAPE TIED TO ITS NECK RUNS BY! THAT WAS WEIRD!
WORMS ARE CRAWLING IN THE DIRT! THEY'VE INGESTED PLANTS SO YOU SOLD THEM AS FISH BAIT!

seed.name: Baby Sativo
seed.description: This short, thick plant is cheap and grows quickly. A good beginner's plant! The tough, fibrous stalks can be woven into incredibly efficient and powerful ropes, used in a number of industries.

seed.name: Sativo
seed.description: Your basic small green Verde. The thick stalk and arms on this plant are often crushed and used as wood pulp.

seed.name: Tri-Sativo
seed.description: A mid-sized crop of green-leaved Verde. This star-shaped plant has a strong, deep root system and makes an efficient biofuel.

seed.name: Full Sativo
seed.description: A hearty crop of green-leaved Verde. This strong, resilient Verde can be used to strengthen concrete in building foundations and reinforcement bars.

seed.name: Big Sativo
seed.description: This green Verde towers over its little brothers and sisters once it's fully mature! The hairy leaves on this tall plant are used to create industrial bags and consumer-grade paper and clothing.

seed.name: Alien
seed.description: The Alien is covered with a thick, viscous oil that's remarkably resistant to water. As such, it's used to make sails, water-proof ropes and even as a coating for submarines and other deep-sea equipment.

seed.name: Baby Berry
seed.description: This short, squat plant is primarily used to create a high-quality paper, which can be recycled many more times than traditional paper.

seed.name: Snowcap
seed.description: Snow tips are popular for being easy to grow and maintain, although they develop rather slowly. It's a tough plant that can withstand any climate. Its thick, bulky core is used in many recyclable plastics.

seed.name: Berry
seed.description: Your basic small red berry. The oil contained in the leaves of this profitable plant are often extracted and used to make medicines or diet supplements.

seed.name: SweetPine
seed.description: While Sweet Pine is commonly associated with cold weather, it's actually a hardy perennial, able to grow in a wide range of climates. Popular as a holiday decoration among bohemian types.

seed.name: Aqua P-14
seed.description: This hardy and aromatic plant originates from a valley in India. Its purple core in full bloom is an essential component in many heat-resistant plastics.

seed.name: Rare Sativo
seed.description: Watch out, this green Verde is huge - and valuable - once it's fully grown! This bushy plant is used as a cooking oil and in cereals.

seed.name: Mini Indigo
seed.description: Your basic small blue indigo. This versatile plant grows quickly and is used in a number of different industries, including construction, biofuels and as a supplement in paint.

seed.name: Indigo
seed.description: This tough, roughly textured plant is used to make clothing, most commonly denim jeans and gloves. Fun fact - the first American Flag was made from this strain of hemp!

seed.name: Tri-Berry
seed.description: This delicately fragrant plant is renowned for its antimicrobial properties and is used in a wide variety of skin and hair care products.

seed.name: Desert Palm
seed.description: A somewhat foul-smelling plant. Popular among landscapers, despite the odor, as its fibers and leaves can be used to make mulch.

seed.name: Full Berry
seed.description: A large crop of red-leaved berry. Proteins found in this bushy plant can be used as a supplement in nutritious (and delicious!) cat, dog and horse food.

seed.name: Tri-Indigo
seed.description: The leaves of this dark Indigo are usually small, but valuable for soaps and perfumes. A great plant for indoor or outdoor growth, emits a pleasant scent that doesn't become oppressive in small spaces.

seed.name: Big Berry
seed.description: Though the leathery leaves on this plant are generally considered too tough to be used commercially, the dark, hard seeds can be ground up to create expensive medicines.

seed.name: Spider
seed.description: Too fragile for use in commercial products, The Spider is highly-sought by esoteric practictioners for its (rumored) supernatural properties. It is difficult to harvest because it grows slowly but wilts quickly.

seed.name: Igloo
seed.description: The Igloo is part of a remarkable example of symbiosis, as small mammals use it for both shelter and sustenance. Native to Canada's Northwest Territories, this unusual breed has little commerical value.

seed.name: Sour Indigo
seed.description: This uncommon Indigo is noteworthy for the strange and powerful odor it emits at maturity. Harvest it soon, before it stinks up the place! Used to make health cereals, though they're not very popular...

seed.name: Rare Berry
seed.description: This giant plant is slow to grow but very valuable. It's used to create luxury fabrics and is in high demand from fashion designers around the world.

seed.name: Mayan
seed.description: This plant has been cultivated for hundreds, if not thousands, of years along the coasts of Africa and South America. The seeds can be ground into a rich oil, used as an anaesthetic and in religious rituals.

seed.name: Paradise
seed.description: The colorful Paradise has a remarkably short life cycle for a plant of its usefulness and profitability. Used to make a relatively light and inexpensive fuel for air and space travel.

seed.name: Big Indigo
seed.description: This profitable blue indigo grows slowly, but is impressive when fully mature! The seeds and stalks of this plant are unrivaled as livestock feed and bedding.

seed.name: Neon
seed.description: This popular plant is characterized by its neon glow. It produces large, crystalline leaves, used in telephone wires and cellphones. They also make great decorations and gifts!

seed.name: Cali
seed.description: Cali has become a popular choice in rural regions of western North America, due to the year-round sunshine. The fibers of its stems are used in a substantial portion of commercial hemp thread and yarn.

seed.name: Drift
seed.description: Don't let its soft exterior fool you: Drift is one of the hardiest hemp strains, able to grow in any climate. Its fibers can be woven into soft, cushiony fabric that has outscored cotton in blind tests.

seed.name: Rare Indigo
seed.description: The starch that can be extracted from this giant plant is used to create plastics. The Rare Indigo was famously used by Henry Ford to create a plastic-based car body in 1941.

seed.name: Hawaiian
seed.description: The fiber from this plant can be woven into luminescent clothing and even used to reinforce fiber-optic telecommunication networks. Native to its namesake, it's a slow growing plant that loves the sun.

seed.name: Oracle
seed.description: This strange plant has deep roots and can sustain itself in almost any environment. The leaves, and especially the gnarled core, can be ground into a potent powder used for medical treatment and research.

seed.name: Holiday
seed.description: A popular cold-weather plant that has survived through the ages. It's been well documented that a half bushel of these leaves were among the lesser-known gifts of the Magi to baby Christ.

seed.name: Bone Seed
seed.description: This ancient strain of hemp is still in use by Aboriginal shamans. Modern medicine also has an interest in this plant, as it is a powerful pain-killer and aphrodisiac with no side effects or addictive properties.

seed.name: SilverStar
seed.description: The Silver Star's seeds produce a metallic, non-corrosive oil that's a key ingredient in monochromatic stainless steel alloys. A highly valuable plant, it's also strikingly beautiful.

seed.name: Oily Lotus
seed.description: This plant has a light, summery fragrance that bugs find irresistible, though they tend to get stuck in its sticky excretions. The oil extracted from this plant is a powerful lubricant, used in subways and railroads.

seed.name: Superstar
seed.description: The waxy outer layer of this prismatic plant is often noticed for its foul scent and variety of vivid hues. The odor is lost in processing, leaving this strain a perfect ingredient in non-toxic paints and crayons.

seed.name: Golden
seed.description: This radiant plant is its own light source. It's a common component in solar panels, flashlights and rechargable batteries... or even just as a decoration!

seed.name: Magic
seed.description: This plant requires careful attention, but excels under the right conditions. It grows slowly and produces huge, bulbous crystals that are used for psychic healing and in hexacore microprocessors.

seed.name: Especial
seed.description: Native to eastern Hawaii. Its flower features prominently in ancient Polynesian texts, possibly as an object of worship. Recently its oil was discovered to be one of the world's most efficient biofuels.

seed.name: Rainbow
seed.description: A rare seed, the Rainbow's eye-catching leaves are a key component in modern, high resolution LCD screens and touchscreens.

seed.name: Gum Blend
seed.description: This hybrid is the result of a Rare Berry cross-bred with Aqua P-14. As one might expect, it's used to create durable, flexible plastics that are soft and smooth.

seed.name: Mystic
seed.description: Traditionally used in the production of illuminated manuscripts, the Mystic is still in demand by a number of esoteric churches and gnostic movements. It is unknown to what ends these groups use this plant.

seed.name: Malibu
seed.description: A fast-growing seed that hails from its namesake, Malibu California. Generally grown in bulk and used as mulch for flowers, or even for more valuable hemp!

seed.name: Blueberry
seed.description: The Blueberry is popular among farmers for its pleasing smell and unusual appearance. It's well-loved by rabbits, foxes and other pests as well! The plant is used to make rich, vibrant dyes and ink.

seed.name: Northern
seed.description: This innocuous-looking plant is one of the most bizarre species known to man. The slow-growing Northern is 99% crystal and 1% organic matter. Too delicate for practical use, it is prized by collectors.

seed.name: rareSnowtip
seed.description: An unlikely mutation of Snow Tips that grows slowly, but wilts within just minutes of blossoming. Beware! This strain's short maturity phase also makes it almost impossible to properly research and reproduce.

seed.name: Snowflake
seed.description: The Snowflake's complex leaf structure is so unique, no two look alike. Its thick cellulose fibres can be used to create flexible, porous material with the strength of plastic. Thrives when out of the sun.

seed.name: Firefly
seed.description: Firefly leaves contain a chemical compound that's sensitive to light and moisture levels. Studies published by agicultural institutes in India suggest this plant achieves best results in dark subterranean settings.

seed.name: Electric
seed.description: A recently-discovered and extremely rare mutation of the Neon strain. Currently in demand by high-tech research labs who believe proper cultures may create the ideal battery source for electric-powered cars.

item.name: PIZZA
item.description: A delicious pie from the local pizzeria, prepared with love and seasoned with garlic powder, pepper flakes, oregano and cigarette smoke. Be careful not to burn the roof of your mouth!
item.uses: Chow down for an instant XP bonus.

item.name: BANANAS
item.description: Some claim that the humble banana is proof of the existence of a divine creator. After all, who else could have designed such a convenient, delicious, individually wrapped fruit?
item.uses: Munch up for an instant XP bonus.

item.name: DICE
item.description: Feeling lucky? Toss some dice! You get three chances!
item.uses: Get rich quick!
item.alert_text: HEY, NICE ROLL! DON'T GO SPENDING IT ALL IN ONE PLACE, NOW!
item.alert_text_lose: AW, SO CLOSE! BETTER LUCK NEXT TIME!

item.name: CARDS
item.description: Feeling REALLY lucky? Pull out the right card and you could WIN BIG! Sure, the odds are lower than the dice, but that just makes the payout all that much sweeter, right?
item.uses: Easy money!
item.alert_text: WHOA! NICE JOB! JUST DON'T GO SPENDING IT ON ANYTHING ILLEGAL.
item.alert_text_lose: AW, THAT'S TOO BAD. NEXT TIME YOU'VE GOT IT FOR SURE.

item.name: FLOWERS
item.description: In addition to adding some color to the farm, these flowers smell great and attract bees and other helpful insects.
item.uses: Neighboring plants grow a little more quickly.

item.name: ROCKS
item.description: Help, I'm a rock! Wow, man, it's a drag being a rock.
item.uses: Neighboring plants wither a little more slowly.

item.name: GNOME
item.description: Little guy, huge help. It often falls on garden gnomes to keep the peace in the chaos of the fields.
item.uses: Neighboring plants yield a little more hemp when harvested.

item.name: HORSESHOES
item.description: The plants can't play, but they seem to wish they could!
item.uses: Neighboring plants respond with quicker grow times.

item.name: HYDRANT
item.description: Hot plants love a refreshing blast from this iconic hydrant.
item.uses: Neighboring plants grant a little more XP when harvested.

item.name: PEACE SIGN
item.description: The peace sign was designed in 1958 to represent the nuclear disarmament movement. Nukes are still around, but so is this ubiquitous symbol!
item.uses: All plants on the farm wither a little more slowly.

item.name: POND
item.description: Whoa, the fish just keep circling round and round... what? Oh, this pond is great for keeping the soil on the farm fertile and moist.
item.uses: All plants on the farm grant a little more XP when harvested.

item.name: BONES
item.description: This ancient skeleton holds a profound symbolic significance... or maybe it just looks cool.
item.uses: Neighboring plants wither more slowly.

item.name: PHONOGRAPH
item.description: All the crackling and fuzz can be kinda charming... if you're from your grandpa's generation, that is.
item.uses: Neighboring plants yield more hemp when harvested.

item.name: FLAMINGO
item.description: This hot pink flamingo knows how to keep things cool. The plants groove on his eerie vibrations!
item.uses: All plants on the farm yield a little more hemp when harvested.

item.name: FOUNTAIN
item.description: Water spills endlessly from the top of this statue's bowl and seeps into the soil of nearby plants.
item.uses: Plants in neighboring tiles grant a lot more XP when harvested.

item.name: SPOT LIGHT
item.description: A niftier take on the lightbulb. Let your plants photosynthesize in style with a wave of colorful lights... and save energy, too!
item.uses: Neighboring plants grow more quickly.

item.name: BOOMBOX
item.description: This little radio has no shame. It'll switch between Pink Floyd and Katy Perry without skipping a beat. The sound stimulates nearby plants!
item.uses: Neighboring plants yield a lot more hemp when harvested.

item.name: ORNAMENT
item.description: Handed down through the ages, this perfectly shaped crystal is the emblem of hypnotic pleasure. It scatters refracted light all over nearby plants.
item.uses: Neighboring plants wither a lot more slowly.

item.name: SATYR
item.description: Oh sweet, it's a Satyr playing music! He only seems to know classic show tunes, but it's better than nothing...
item.uses: All plants on the farm yield more hemp when harvested.

item.name: HOSE
item.description: This flexible tube is easy to use and provides great water pressure. Just turn the spigot!
item.uses: Neighboring plants grant MUCH more XP when harvested.

item.name: MIRROR
item.description: Capable of harnessing and unleashing severe concentrations of light energy. Not for the faint of heart.
item.uses: Neighboring plants grow MUCH more quickly.

item.name: SPRINKLER
item.description: Waters plants through patterns of equal distribution. Simple, yet effective. Who needs rain when you've got one of these?
item.uses: All plants on the farm grant more XP when harvested.

item.name: MOAI
item.description: This monolithic man serves as a communication conduit to the gods of agriculture.
item.uses: Neighboring plants yield more hemp and XP.

item.name: INCENSE
item.description: The rich and powerful aroma of this burning incense wafts all over the farm. It smells... like mystery!
item.uses: All plants on the farm grow more quickly and wither slowly.

item.name: BUDDHA
item.description: The statue of this portly, jovial god smiles fortune upon you. Rub his belly for good luck!
item.uses: All plants on the farm yield more hemp and XP.

item.name: LIL' HELPER
item.description: This chilly little dude is visiting from the North Pole!
item.uses: All plants on the farm grant MUCH more XP while snowing.

item.name: HATCH
item.description: Your standard, everyday, run-of-the-mill hatch. Looks pretty old. Has its serial code, 4815162342, engraved along the side.
item.uses: Unknown, but seems to invite explorers...
